releases/0/tender/description:
Public Health England is looking to award a 4 year contract for the provision of Foetal Bovine Serum for use in the General Collection Banking department, PHE Culture Collections. 

To access the tender the interested parties should go to https://phe.bravosolution.co.uk and look for itt_3011 or Project 3731 or Search for PHE_Scientific_Foetal Bovine Serum

releases/0/tender/title: St Leger Homes of Doncaster Provision of Waste Management Services REF SLH17-CC71
releases/0/tender/description: St Leger Homes of Doncaster Ltd provides the management of approximately 20,500 homes and a portfolio of other properties such as shops and community centres on behalf of Doncaster Metropolitan Borough Council. The management of these properties includes repairs and maintenance, which could be internal or external works. The teams within the repairs service are Responsive Repairs, Planned and Scheduled Repairs, Void (empty) property repairs, and Electrical and Mechanical (Electrical and Gas). Waste Management Operator(s) are to be appointed to deliver waste management services on behalf of St Leger Homes. This will include the delivery of skips and containers to sites as requested, and to collect or exchange within the timescales or frequency detailed in the specification. There is also a requirement to collect and dispose of hazardous waste streams and waste that needs to be segregated and disposed of safely in accordance with legislation. This contract is to be awarded on the basis of Lots. Full details can be found in the specification. The contract is for a 2 year period with options to extend of 2 x 12 months. This opportunity has been advertised on the Official Journal of the European Union ref 2017/S 222-461666.

releases/0/tender/title: Asset Validation, Compliance Testing Services and the Network Check of Natural Gas Systems
releases/0/tender/description:
the Employer is seeking competitive Tenders ("Tenders") from suitably qualified contractors ("Contractors") in response to this Invitation to Tender ("ITT") with a view to awarding a Contract to one contractor for the asset validation and compliance validation of this equipment. For the avoidance of doubt the range of equipment to be included within this contract shall include, but not be limited to, the following items.
    •The entire natural gas pipework system from the main gas shipper incoming supply meter up to every appliance or outlet terminal.
    •Where there is any shipper pipework BEFORE the incoming meter within any building then include this pipework as if owned by the University.
    •Include all pipeline assemblies, brackets and components including valves, meters, filters, regulators etc. 
    
    The contract will begin on 1 November 2017 for a 12 month period, with an option to extend annually for a further 4 years.

releases/0/tender/title: The provision of Catering Services at College Court
releases/0/tender/description:
College Court is a wholly owned subsidiary of the University of Leicester and is its first all year round conference centre. The centre is registered as a limited company and is required to provide a financial return for the University and support its strategic objectives.
      
      College Court is letting a contract for its Food and Beverage requirements to an external provider and is seeking competitive prices from Service Providers for this service. The contract will be awarded for in initial period of 5 years from 1 September 2017 until 31 August 2022 with an option to extend annually for a further 5 years until 31 August 2027. The optional extensions are dependent on satisfactory performance.
      Bidders are required to provide proposals on the basis of cost plus and performance guarantee models, and also fully comprehensive or semi comprehensive models for maintenance of assets.

releases/0/tender/description: The Police & Crime Commissioner for Merseyside has been notified that she will be awarded grant funding  to the value of £462,500 by the Home Office, under the Violence against Women and Girls (VAWG) Service Transformation Fund. The grant issued to Merseyside is to commission a service to support Sex Workers across all environments within Merseyside over a 3 year period. The grant available (£462,250) is to cover this 3 year period.

releases/0/tender/title: Network Homes - Clerk of Works Framework
releases/0/tender/description:
Text to be corrected in the original notice:
        Place of text to be modified: Time limit for receipt of tenders or requests to participate
        Instead of: 
        Read: 
        Other additional information: Please note that an extension of time has been granted.  The Tender submission deadline is now 19th December 2017 at 12noon.
        Network Homes (Network) are a Housing Association who own and manage 20,000 homes across London,
        Hertfordshire and the South East. To support their ongoing development programme, in which they are
        committed to developing 1,000 new homes each year, Network are seeking to establish a Clerk of Works
        Framework. The anticipated value of the Framework is circa 450,000 GBP per annum over the 4 year
        Framework duration (1,800,000 GBP in total).

        Other additional information: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.

        Provision of Domiciliary Care Services to residents within Stoke-on-Trent. 
        There are two different lots available 
        1 - Guaranteed Hours, 
        2 - Ad-hoc Service Requirements Framework.
        
        Bidders can choose to bid for either or both lots.
